result.execSummary:
The defendant Chrystopher J Verba was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: PTAC], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Each ct concur. Counsel to file STAO re: credit if any.
3/1/18 Probation is extended for 1 yr from 4/7/18 to 4/7/19, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.

miscConds.notes: Crt signed order.   To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$253  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with WG, FA or CA.

Def to file all tax returns on time with copy to agent within 1 week and all refunds to be applied to restitution owed.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Court costs remitted. $342  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

defn has new charges, state requested continuance, requested Ct refer defn to BMP and add condition re GED as part of referral; Atty Cornia in agreement; Ct will reschedule plea and signed referral to BMP

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND - CONDITIONS MODIFIED - BMP REFERRAL
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his release from jail.  
- If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $500 (per case), as cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant shall continue working toward obtaining his GED.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Craig A., William G., or Frencesco A.
- Defendant shall be within his residence between the hours of 6 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment.
Trial Judge -  Br 15
Plea hearing on June 4, 2015 at 10:15 am.
